013package org.apache.juneau.csv.annotation;
014
015import static java.lang.annotation.ElementType.*;
016import static java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy.*;
017
018import java.lang.annotation.*;
019
020import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
021import org.apache.juneau.csv.*;
022
023/**
024 * Annotation that can be applied to classes, fields, and methods to tweak how they are handled by {@link CsvSerializer} and {@link CsvParser}.
025 *
026 * <p>
027 * Can be used in the following locations:
028 * <ul>
029 *    <li>Marshalled classes/methods/fields.
030 *    <li><ja>@Rest</ja>-annotated classes and <ja>@RestOp</ja>-annotated methods when an {@link #on()} value is specified.
031 * </ul>
032 *
033 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
034
035 * </ul>
036 */
037@Documented
038@Target({TYPE,FIELD,METHOD})
039@Retention(RUNTIME)
040@Inherited
041@Repeatable(CsvAnnotation.Array.class)
042@ContextApply(CsvAnnotation.Apply.class)
043public @interface Csv {
044
045    /**
046     * Optional description for the exposed API.
047     *
048     * @return The annotation value.
049     * @since 9.2.0
050     */
051    String[] description() default {};
052
053    /**
054    * Dynamically apply this annotation to the specified classes/methods/fields.
055    *
056    * <p>
057    * Used in conjunction with {@link org.apache.juneau.BeanContext.Builder#applyAnnotations(Class...)} to dynamically apply an annotation to an existing class/method/field.
058    * It is ignored when the annotation is applied directly to classes/methods/fields.
059    *
060    * <h5 class='section'>Valid patterns:</h5>
061    * <ul class='spaced-list'>
062    *  <li>Classes:
063    *       <ul>
064    *          <li>Fully qualified:
065    *             <ul>
066    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass"</js>
067    *             </ul>
068    *          <li>Fully qualified inner class:
069    *             <ul>
070    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass$Inner1$Inner2"</js>
071    *             </ul>
072    *          <li>Simple:
073    *             <ul>
074    *                <li><js>"MyClass"</js>
075    *             </ul>
076    *          <li>Simple inner:
077    *             <ul>
078    *                <li><js>"MyClass$Inner1$Inner2"</js>
079    *                <li><js>"Inner1$Inner2"</js>
080    *                <li><js>"Inner2"</js>
081    *             </ul>
082    *       </ul>
083    *    <li>Methods:
084    *       <ul>
085    *          <li>Fully qualified with args:
086    *             <ul>
087    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myMethod(String,int)"</js>
088    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myMethod(java.lang.String,int)"</js>
089    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myMethod()"</js>
090    *             </ul>
091    *          <li>Fully qualified:
092    *             <ul>
093    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myMethod"</js>
094    *             </ul>
095    *          <li>Simple with args:
096    *             <ul>
097    *                <li><js>"MyClass.myMethod(String,int)"</js>
098    *                <li><js>"MyClass.myMethod(java.lang.String,int)"</js>
099    *                <li><js>"MyClass.myMethod()"</js>
100    *             </ul>
101    *          <li>Simple:
102    *             <ul>
103    *                <li><js>"MyClass.myMethod"</js>
104    *             </ul>
105    *          <li>Simple inner class:
106    *             <ul>
107    *                <li><js>"MyClass$Inner1$Inner2.myMethod"</js>
108    *                <li><js>"Inner1$Inner2.myMethod"</js>
109    *                <li><js>"Inner2.myMethod"</js>
110    *             </ul>
111    *       </ul>
112    *    <li>Fields:
113    *       <ul>
114    *          <li>Fully qualified:
115    *             <ul>
116    *                <li><js>"com.foo.MyClass.myField"</js>
117    *             </ul>
118    *          <li>Simple:
119    *             <ul>
120    *                <li><js>"MyClass.myField"</js>
121    *             </ul>
122    *          <li>Simple inner class:
123    *             <ul>
124    *                <li><js>"MyClass$Inner1$Inner2.myField"</js>
125    *                <li><js>"Inner1$Inner2.myField"</js>
126    *                <li><js>"Inner2.myField"</js>
127    *             </ul>
128    *       </ul>
129    *    <li>A comma-delimited list of anything on this list.
130    * </ul>
131    *
132\   * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
133    *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/DynamicallyAppliedAnnotations">Dynamically Applied Annotations</a>
134    * </ul>
135    *
136    * @return The annotation value.
137    */
138   String[] on() default {};
139
140   /**
141    * Dynamically apply this annotation to the specified classes.
142    *
143    * <p>
144    * Identical to {@link #on()} except allows you to specify class objects instead of a strings.
145    *
146    * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
147    *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="https://juneau.apache.org/docs/topics/DynamicallyAppliedAnnotations">Dynamically Applied Annotations</a>
148    * </ul>
149    *
150    * @return The annotation value.
151    */
152   Class<?>[] onClass() default {};
153}
